DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Malignant Breast Neoplasm Performed Last Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of the last diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue, for a malignant breast neoplasm, a breast neoplasm with metastatic potential arising from the breast parenchyma or the nipple.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Malignant Breast Neoplasm Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue, for a malignant breast neoplasm, a breast neoplasm with metastatic potential arising from the breast parenchyma or the nipple.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A breast neoplasm with metastatic potential arising from the breast parenchyma or the nipple.  The most common are breast carcinomas.  Malignant breast neoplasms occur more frequently in females than in males. -- 2003:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the breast.  The vast majority of cases are carcinomas arising from the breast parenchyma or the nipple.  Malignant breast neoplasms occur more frequently in females than in males.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the last date of an evaluation, assessment, or treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
